intro: Fridericia nicotianiflora, commonly known as the tobacco-leaf shrub, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that resemble those of tobacco. It produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Fridericia nicotianiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils in full sun.
